ParentsHelp: It helps parents know the student’s level and how to develop it and talk to teachers about their level.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.intro: Protecting your private information is our priority. This Statement of Privacy applies to http://www.unih0me.com and Unihome and governs data collection and usage. For the purposes of this Privacy Policy, unless otherwise noted, all references to Unihome include http://www.unih0me.com and Unihome. The Unihome website is an Online language platform for teaching and learning foreign languages. site. By using the Unihome website, you consent to the data practices described in this statement.

section1.title: Collection of your Personal Information
section1.content: In order to better provide you with products and services offered on our Site, Unihome may collect personally identifiable information, such as your: - First and Last Name - Mailing Address - E-mail Address - Phone Number - credentials and college degrees, certificates, etc. If you purchase Unihome's products and services, we collect billing and credit card information. This information is used to complete the purchase transaction.

section2.title: Use of your Personal Information
section2.content: Unihome collects and uses your personal information to operate its website(s) and deliver the services you have requested. Unihome may also use your personally identifiable information to inform you of other products or services available from Unihome and its affiliates.

section3.title: Sharing Information with Third Parties
section3.content: Unihome does not sell, rent or lease its customer lists to third parties. Unihome may share data with trusted partners to help perform statistical analysis, send you email or postal mail, provide customer support, or arrange for deliveries.

section4.title: Automatically Collected Information
section4.content: Information about your computer hardware and software may be automatically collected by Unihome. This information can include your IP address, browser type, domain names, access times, and referring website addresses.

section5.title: Use of Cookies
section5.content: The Unihome website may use 'cookies' to help you personalize your online experience. A cookie is a text file that is placed on your hard disk by a web page server.

section6.title: Links
section6.content: This website contains links to other sites. Please be aware that we are not responsible for the content or privacy practices of such other sites.

section7.title: Security of your Personal Information
section7.content: Unihome secures your personal information from unauthorized access, use, or disclosure. Unihome uses the following methods for this purpose: - SSL Protocol

section8.title: Children Under Thirteen
section8.content: Unihome does not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under the age of thirteen.

section9.title: Right to Erasure
section9.content: You may ask us to delete or remove your Personal Data, such as where you withdraw your consent.

section10.title: Deletion of an Account
section10.content: You may request to delete your Account at any time, however, there are no refunds for cancellation.

section11.title: E-mail Communications
section11.content: From time to time, Unihome may contact you via email for the purpose of providing announcements, promotional offers, alerts, confirmations, surveys, and/or other general communication.

section12.title: Changes to this Statement
section12.content: Unihome reserves the right to change this Privacy Policy from time to time.

section13.title: Contact Information
section13.content: Unihome welcomes your questions or comments regarding this Statement of Privacy.

To ensure accuracy and security, regular: The current amount is the price of the lectures, not the price of the course you paid for. To ensure accuracy and security, regularly review your wallet details by verifying transaction histories, checking balances, and confirming the authenticity of each entry.Stay vigilant for any discrepancies and update your information as needed to maintain full control over your account.

policy.title: Welcome to UniHome Support
policy.introduction: The UniHome Support team is pleased to assist you with your inquiries. Through this platform, we ensure that you, our students, receive the support you need efficiently.
policy.commitment: We understand that reaching a solution may sometimes take longer than expected, and we want to assure you that we are committed to resolving your issues as quickly as possible, thanks to the support of our dedicated team.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.description1: You can specify multiple resources for additional support if needed. You can also choose an alternative resource provider for this support.
rights.description2: You have the right to cancel any support service within 24 hours of its activation and to reassign it to another resource.
rights.description3: You can change the resource at any time; however, support will only be provided within the next 24 hours.
rights.description4: If you decide later that you want to cancel, you can turn off the service through technical support if needed.
rights.description5: If you reassign support, it should be done 24 hours before the start time.

contact.title: Contact Support
contact.description: You can contact UniHome through the Chat function if you need assistance with your inquiries after adding or adjusting a resource.

updates.title: Decisions and Updates
updates.description: Changes, additions, and cancellations of support services can be managed on www.unih0me.com.

escalation.title: Escalation Policy
escalation.description: You can escalate any unresolved support request with UniHome if you have concerns or need additional support.

retention.title: Data Retention Policy
retention.description: The UniHome Support team may review and update your request. If it is not possible to provide further service, your request will be retained as per UniHome's privacy policy.
